pageContext.claim: “Our corporate taxes were the highest in the world.”
pageContext.analysis: Before the tax cut, the United States certainly had one of the highest statutory corporate tax rates in the world, pegged as high as 39.1 percent when including state taxes. Trump is comparing that to the average rate for the other members of the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development, which is 25.5 percent when not weighted for GDP. But the official rate does not necessarily tell the whole story. What also matters is the actual tax a company pays, after deductions and tax benefits -- the effective tax rate. According to the Congressional Research Service, the effective rate for the United States was 27.1 percent, compared to an effective GDP-weighted average of 27.7 percent for the OECD.
